alert.note: Alert for Kent (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 4:32PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Delaware, including the following county, Kent and northeast Maryland, including the following counties, Caroline and Talbot. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 432 PM EST, flooding was ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - For St. Jones River at Dover: At 4:15pm the stage was 6.4 feet. Flood Stage is 6.5 feet. ... For Choptank at Greensboro: At 4:15pm the stage was 8.87 feet. Flood Stage is 9 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
